name: Crunch-Compressed LBR File
summary: Learn about .LZR files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Developer Gary P. Novosielski created the LU archiving utility in the early 1980s, for use with the CP/M and DOS operating systems. Primarily, developers use LU to package software programs in LBR files, for distribution to end users. Notably, however, LBR files are not compressed.
To share LBR files more efficiently, developers often compress the files using a compression utility. LBR files that are Crunch-compressed are typically renamed to use the .lzr extension.
NOTE: LBR files compressed with Squeeze use the .LQR extension.

instructions: You can use CFX (Windows), The Unarchiver (Mac), or lbrate (Linux) to extract the files an LZR file contains. These utilities can both decompress an LZR file and expand the resulting LBR file.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
